title: Merge pull request #5 from danielgindi/master
message:
Merge pull request #5 from danielgindi/master

Adjustments for compilation on MSVC and windows compilers in general

title: pthread is the unix way of doing threads and mutexes.
message:
pthread is the unix way of doing threads and mutexes.
I have added a MACRO that uses either CRITICAL_SECTION or pthread_mutex depeneding on whether it's windows or unix.
And because a CRITICAL_SECTION has the bonus of being recursive by default, I've added the recursive attribute to the pthread mutexes.

title: A void* pointer cannot be used for arithmetic operations in most compilers,…
message: A void* pointer cannot be used for arithmetic operations in most compilers, because of the size by which it needs to increment/decrement is unknown. We need to define char* in order to increment by measures of 8 bits.

title: MSVC compatibility - WIN32 is a global definition for all windows compilers,…
message: MSVC compatibility - WIN32 is a global definition for all windows compilers, MSVC, MINGW32 and other. It even works for x64 and Itanium...

title: Winsock2 should be included before any windows.h include.
message:
Winsock2 should be included before any windows.h include.
That's because there are duplicate #defines, and when Winsock2 is defined before windows.h then windows.h detects that and prevent redefinition.
That is the official way stated by Microsoft.

title: Fix false fallback when client joins an existing mcast group with high traffic.
message:
Fix false fallback when client joins an existing mcast group with high traffic.

Only take action upon loss rate when the deques are at least half full.

When a client joins a multicast group with heavy traffic going on, it will lose
a lot of packets in the very beginning because there is a considerable time
amount between it's multicast socket creation and the first read. Thus, the socket
buffer is likely to overflow in this start situation, resulting in packet loss.

title: Compute loss/NACK ratios using a moving average.
message:
Compute loss/NACK ratios using a moving average.

This has advantages over taking a sample every N seconds: First, it's able to catch say a 5sec burst
that could be missed by two adjacent 10sec samples (one catches 2sec, the next one 3sec - no action triggered
although condition present). Second, this way we're able to show a value to the user every second independent
of the sample time frame.

Instead of asking for framebuffer updates after a received server
message, we can now ask continously. This is especially useful on
high latency links.

title: Fix bug where fast server would make GUI unresponsive on slow client.
message:
Fix bug where fast server would make GUI unresponsive on slow client.

This uses VNCConn's blocking mode, so is probably not a good
thing to do in the multicast case (packet loss while blocking
because of full receive buffer).

title: VNCConn: implement an optional blocking mode.
message:
VNCConn: implement an optional blocking mode.

When enabled, the worker thread blocks after sending an update
notify event until UpdateProcessed() is called from the main
thread. This way a slow drawing engine can be synchronized 
with a fast VNCConn. Default is OFF.
